attributes.comment:
To whom it may concern,

First I would like to thank you for taking the time to read this comment. Second, I
realize that the cost of processing these applications increase every year. But for
those of us who are adopting from China, this is a process we have to endure
twice. This is because of the length of time that is currently required.

Well, the increase in cost will stop no one from adopting, it is one more financial
hurtle that must be over come. A hurtle among many that continue to grow
higher. Most of us have already moved into financial areas that have and will have
future constraints placed on our budgets. But they are ones we will
endure............

The pursuit of happiness.........That is all we seek. What a wonderful idea. A true
theology to be proud. Do we not also deserve the same compassion that other
American parents receive? As I have said, I understand the need to pay for
government by those that use it. But surely, a provision for those of us who have
already paid once can be added.

I am very satisfied with how the Northern Virginia office has handled every aspect
of our paper work. And do not begrudge them the fee. But unlike others, those of
us going to China leave the first application process with nothing to show for it.

I am a Virginia, my family has proudly lived here since 1674. My wife and I will
never be able to have our own biological children. But we are looking forward to be
able to call this child are own. Adoptive children will require more attention,
medical care and have more physical needs than biological children usually do.
All of these things takes time and money. So well this may seem like a small
hurtle, it may possible remove the means for a future need..

Thanks to our government and the government of China we will be able to pursue
happiness.

Thank you again for your time,

John and Kathy Halvorsen
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by John Halvorsen
